title: How to Make Raspberry Cordial

steps.headline: Place the raspberries in a food processor.
Cut the rind off the orange.
steps.description: Remove any of the white pith.

text: Place the raspberries in a food processor. Process the raspberries until smooth. Cut the rind off the orange. Remove any of the white pith. Mix the water and the sugar in the saucepan. Over a low heat, stir the sugar around until it dissolves. Once the sugar has dissolved, add the orange peel. Bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat and allow simmering for 2 minutes. Add the raspberry puree. Leave the entire mixture to cool. Once cooled, strain the mixture through a sieve. Doing this will remove the raspberry seeds. Pour the strained mixture into a bottle or jug. It is now ready for drinking, or you can keep it in the refrigerator for up to 4 days. Serve. To make a drink, dilute the cordial using either soda water, water, or fizzy lemonade. Other uses include drizzling it over ice cream, yogurt, or a pudding. It can also be added to cocktails that need a raspberry flavour.
